title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition
notes:
Game starts fine after doing the following to fix the black screen issue on startup.
using winetricks add the videomemorysize=2048 into the registry. (havnt tried default memsize option). Online multiplayer does not work.

notes: Intro videos work. After that it's black screen with music and menu sounds from the invisible menu.

title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

notes: Runs perfectly out of the box, the text is not totally clean though
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

notes:
Using winecfg on the game prefix and setting Windows version to Windows XP fixes the blackscreen issue after videos.

$ WINEPREFIX=~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/475150/pfx winecfg
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10 / DRM 3.26.0 / 4.18.11-200.fc28.x86_64, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes:
Before tweaks the game will not display intro videos and then has menu as a black screen. (Although you can move the mouse around and hear the sound indicators when you hover over a button, so you can select the bottom most button and exit). 

After tweaks, the performance is better than native Windows 10 x64 (intermittent black screen stutters). I played for several hours without any problems.

Tweaks:
From a terminal run: 
WINEPREFIX=~/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/475150/pfx winetricks msxml3 d3dx9_36 corefonts
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

notes:
character and NPCs are invisible, after changing the "detail level" to normal or low, most of the NPCs are visible and part of the character is visible, but when you change armor, you cannot see the effect on the character and some monsters are still invisible.
Tried changing to WinXP/Win10 mode using winecfg, didn't help.
Tried other tweaks in this page, also didn't help.
Tried using WineD3d11 and disabling d3d11, also didn't help.
Even tried Win10 "safe mode", no success.
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

notes: Game runs fine on single player. Multiplayer is not working.
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 570 Series (POLARIS10 / DRM 3.23.0 / 4.15.0-36-generic, LLVM 6.0.0)
notes: Just like Win10.... even better... It worked perfectly right out of the box
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

notes:
Update:
After running:
WINEPREFIX=/home/maxim/Games/Steam/SteamApps/compatdata/475150/pfx wine regedit  (replace the path to your path to Steam)

And creating a registry key at:
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Wine\Direct3D\CheckFloatConstants enabled

The game now runs perfectly.
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition

notes:
It works very good in single player (did not try multiplayer, but if it's buggy as it was on Windows... I don't even want to try).
The only problems are some spike fps drops when the HDD reads, mostly when using the portal, it's annoying but nothing major.
title: Titan Quest Anniversary Edition
